title: Strawberry and chocolate = fresa y chocolate
creator_contributor_role: Cuban Institute of Arts and Film Industry, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Machismo
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Cuba - Politics and government
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Gay and lesbian studies
description: A young Cuban Communist Party cadre is shocked to find himself pursued by a witty, handsome homosexual. By exploring the friendship that develops between a straight man and a gay man in a culture which forbids open expression of homosexuality, "Strawberry and Chocolate" manages to raise important political questions while remaining delightfully comic throughout. The film exposes Cuba's anti-gay laws by showing the important role gay and lesbian revolutionaries, writers and artists played in Cuban culture and examines how political censorship in any context only impoverishes a society. Jorge Perugorria and Vladimir Cruz are excellent as the two friends and Mirta Ibarra steals every scene she is in as a vivacious and sexy Cuban woman who refuses to allow Latin machismo to dictate her life and choices.
